DataElement.preferredName: Person Pulmonary Function Test Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Prior Registration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has had a pulmonary function test, a broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood, including a measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood prior to registration as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Pulmonary Function Test Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Prior Registration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having had a pulmonary function test, a broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood, including a measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood prior to registration as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Prior Registration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.:A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.

A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
